Improvements.Improvement: Use try-catch block for exception handling
Improvements.Description: Instead of throwing exceptions directly, use a try-catch block to handle exceptions. This will make your code more robust and prevent the program from terminating abruptly in case of an exception.

Improvements.Improvement: Check for null values at the start of the method
Improvements.Description: It is a good practice to check for null values at the start of the method. This helps in avoiding NullPointerExceptions.

Improvements.Improvement: Use StringBuilder's append method instead of '+=' operator
Improvements.Description: Use StringBuilder's append method instead of '+=' operator for appending strings. It is more efficient and improves the performance of string concatenation operations.
